items.title: West Point Alumni Group Cancels Award Honoring Tom Hanks
items.summary: The group was to bestow the Sylvanus Thayer Award on the actor, but it said it was canceling the event to focus on preparing academy cadets for the future.

items.title: John Burton, 92, Dies; California Political Boss Who Staged a Comeback
items.summary: He left the House of Representatives while struggling with a crack addiction, his political career seemingly over. Actually, it had just begun.

items.title: Trump Is Met With Mostly Boos at U.S. Open as Security Delays a Match
items.summary: With the president in attendance at Arthur Ashe Stadium, the men’s final began as hundreds of people were still waiting to go through security screening.

items.title: Maryland Gov. Wes Moore, Pressed About a Possible 2028 Run, Focuses on Re-election
items.summary: Mr. Moore said in a TV interview that he “is not running for president.” The first-term governor, who has traded barbs with President Trump, said he was excited about seeking a second term.

items.title: Trump Downplays Post Threatening Chicago, Saying He Wants to ‘Clean Up’ City
items.summary: The president had said on social media that Chicago was “about to find out why it’s called the Department of WAR,” drawing a fierce rebuke from Democrats.

items.title: RFK Jr., Rejecting Vaccine Data, Fuels Distrust of Public Health Agencies
items.summary: By promoting suspicions about the institutions he oversees, critics say Robert F. Kennedy Jr. is jeopardizing public health. He says he is pursuing transparency.

items.title: Trump news at a glance: President tells foreign companies to ‘respect’ immigration law after Hyundai Ice raid
items.summary: <p>South Korea has said that 300 of its nationals detained during the immigration raid would be flown home. Key US politics stories from Sunday 7 September at a glance</p><p>Donald Trump has told foreign companies that they must hire and train American workers and respect immigration laws, after a raid at a Hyundai Motor manufacturing facility in Georgia saw about 300 South Koreans detained.</p><p>Nearly 500 workers in total were detained in the raid on Thursday, with US authorities releasing footage showing them restrained in handcuffs and ankle chains, loaded on to buses.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/sep/08/trump-administration-news-updates-today">Continue reading...</a>

items.title: Trump issues ‘last warning’ to Hamas to accept Gaza ceasefire deal
items.summary: <p>President says ‘the Israelis have accepted my terms’ and urges release of hostages to secure peace agreement</p><p>Donald Trump on Sunday issued what he called his “last warning” to Hamas, urging the Palestinian militant group to accept a deal to release hostages from Gaza.</p><p>“The Israelis have accepted my Terms. It is time for Hamas to accept as well,” Trump said in a post on his Truth Social platform. “I have warned Hamas about the consequences of not accepting. This is my last warning, there will not be another one!”</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/sep/07/trump-gaza-israeli-hostages">Continue reading...</a>
